Name: Results of noise inspections.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to results of noise inspections

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection

Summary: This bill would mandate that the Department of Environmental Protection publish the results of their noise inspections online within 24 hours after they have been completed.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      Section 1. Section 24-207 of the administrative code of the city of New York, as amended by local law number 53 for the year 2018, is amended to read as follows:
      (f) The commissioner shall publish on the city's website:
      (i) the manner by which noise levels shall be measured during inspections conducted pursuant to this section and in accordance with section 24-217.1 which shall be available online[.] and
      (ii) the results of each inspection, which shall be available online within 24 hours after such inspection has been completed.
      [(f)](g) By no later than January 31 of each year, the department shall submit to the mayor and the council, and publicly post on its website, a report, containing, at a minimum, for the previous calendar year:
      (i) the number of inspectors employed by the department;
      (ii) the number of complaints regarding noise received by the department, disaggregated by the type of noise;
      (iii) the number of after hours noise complaints responded to within the amount of time prescribed by rule as well as the number of duplicative after hours noise complaints;
      (iv) the number of non-violation resolutions to complaints;
      (v) the number of noise related violations issued;
      (vi) the number of such violations which were dismissed;
      (vii) the amount of civil penalties which were paid pursuant to such violations;
      (viii) the number of alternative noise mitigation plans approved pursuant to section 24-221 of this code; and
      (ix) the number of written stop work orders issued pursuant to section 24-223.1 of this code.
      ï¿½ 2. This local law takes effect immediately.
